content:
@Amol Vyas @Mark Roberts

Hi Amol, Mark,
Aetna is preparing an environment to bring to the September connectathon. It will be capable of receiving searches and reads for Patients and CARIN EOBs.

We are looking for other systems and developers to participate with us during the connectathon and would like to reach-out and get them connected prior to the connectathon.

I submitted a request to get access to the participant spreadsheet so that we can add our contact and server information. Can you grant me access or add me to the participant spreadsheet? Also, if any implementers see this message and wish to participate feel free to contact me through zulip.

Thanks
Joel

@Joel Hansen
We'll be happy to test our app against your server. Does it support SMART auth though?

Hi Michele , Thanks for the reply. I checked with the team and we do support SMART Auth, although we don't support Open ID Connect yet. I have a connection guide that I'll send to you via email. Also, I need some details from you so we can do some setup on our end.
Joel

Hello,
Symptomatic is interested in a pre-connectathon setup and testing of BlueButton EOB functionality. We've connected with the Medicare sandbox at Connectathon 23, and have updated our code since. So mostly looking to do some regression testing. Doing an initial connection with Aetna would be great.

Participant: Abigail Watson
Organization: Symptomatic, LLC
Email: abigail@symptomatic.io
Notes: Participating in multiple tracks; may be somewhat overextended on the day of the connectathon.
Smart on FHIR Support: Yes

Abigail Watson said:

Hello,
Symptomatic is interested in a pre-connectathon setup and testing of BlueButton EOB functionality. We've connected with the Medicare sandbox at Connectathon 23, and have updated our code since. So mostly looking to do some regression testing. Doing an initial connection with Aetna would be great.

Participant: Abigail Watson
Organization: Symptomatic, LLC
Email: abigail@symptomatic.io
Notes: Participating in multiple tracks; may be somewhat overextended on the day of the connectathon.
Smart on FHIR Support: Yes

Hi Abigail. Thanks for the interest. I'll send you an email and will get you setup to connect!

Thanks
Joel

@Joel Hansen (Aetna) I am trying the end point, but attempts to get the capability statement at https://qaapih1.aetna.com/fhirdemo/qapath2/v1/metadata fail - getting a 404 Not Found - is that the correct URL?

Michele Mottini said:

Joel Hansen (Aetna) I am trying the end point, but attempts to get the capability statement at https://qaapih1.aetna.com/fhirdemo/qapath2/v1/metadata fail - getting a 404 Not Found - is that the correct URL?

@Michele Mottini We haven't created the capability statement yet so that's probably why you're getting the 404.
Can you fix that please? That's the first thing our client does (as many do I assume), so we cannot test anything else if that does not work
@Joel Hansen (Aetna) I don't see your sandbox endpoint on the Google Docs spreadsheet. Is there somewhere else you have this documented?
@Amy Ballard Hi Amy, thanks for reaching out. Our server requires a firewall to be opened prior to connecting. I'll send you an email and request just a bit of information to get you set up.
@Michele Mottini The capabilitystatment has been created and is available at https://qaapih1.aetna.com/fhirdemo/qapath2/metadata I'll follow up via email as well.
Thanks ... I replied to the email: it is at the wrong URL, and require auth (and it should not)

Joel Hansen (Aetna) said:

Amy Ballard Hi Amy, thanks for reaching out. Our server requires a firewall to be opened prior to connecting. I'll send you an email and request just a bit of information to get you set up.

Hi Amy, Just checking if you were able to try and connect to the Aetna endpoint. Thanks Joel
@Joel Hansen (Aetna) Let me take a look.

Amy Ballard said:

Joel Hansen (Aetna) Let me take a look.

Just checking if you had any luck connecting or if we can provide any support.
